unnormalised: **Fiber-to-Home Expansion Drives Telecommunications Growth in India**
normalised: **Fiber-to-Home Expansion Drives Telecommunications Growth in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The rapid expansion of Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure is significantly contributing to the growth of the telecommunications sector across India. Leading telecom providers like Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively rolling out FTTH networks, aiming to connect millions of homes and businesses with high-speed internet.
normalised: New Delhi – The rapid expansion of Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) infrastructure is significantly contributing to the growth of the telecommunications sector across India. Leading telecom providers like Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively rolling out F T T H networks, aiming to connect millions of homes and businesses with high-speed internet.

unnormalised: This surge in FTTH deployment is particularly evident in tier-II and tier-III cities, bridging the digital divide. Dr. Sharma, a telecom analyst at IIT-Bombay, notes that "FTTH is crucial for supporting India's growing digital economy, facilitating e-commerce, online education, and remote work."
normalised: This surge in F T T H deployment is particularly evident in tier-two and tier-three cities, bridging the digital divide. Doctor Sharma, a telecom analyst at I I T-Bombay, notes that "F T T H is crucial for supporting India's growing digital economy, facilitating e-commerce, online education, and remote work."

unnormalised: Recent government initiatives, including the BharatNet project, are providing further impetus to FTTH adoption. The project aims to connect all gram panchayats with broadband connectivity.
normalised: Recent government initiatives, including the BharatNet project, are providing further impetus to F T T H adoption. The project aims to connect all gram panchayats with broadband connectivity.

unnormalised: Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) data indicates that FTTH subscriptions have witnessed a year-on-year growth of over 40%. Companies are investing heavily, with cumulative investments estimated in the Rs. 50,000 crore range. The average installation cost per household ranges from Rs. 2,500 to Rs. 4,000, depending on location and network complexities. Current deployments are covering areas including housing societies with an average size of 1,200 sq ft per unit. Analysts predict continued growth, with FTTH becoming the dominant broadband technology in India by 2027.
normalised: Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) data indicates that F T T H subscriptions have witnessed a year-on-year growth of over forty percent. Companies are investing heavily, with cumulative investments estimated in the rupee fifty thousand crore range. The average installation cost per household ranges from rupee two thousand five hundred to rupee four thousand, depending on location and network complexities. Current deployments are covering areas including housing societies with an average size of one thousand two hundred square feet per unit. Analysts predict continued growth, with F T T H becoming the dominant broadband technology in India by two thousand twenty seven.
